meanings.definition: A person who campaigns vigorously for political, social, or religious change.
meanings.sent1: The crusaders in our community are always fighting for better schools and parks.
meanings.sent2: The group of crusaders gathered outside the government building to protest for equal rights.
meanings.sent3: The crusaders decided to campaign for more ice cream flavors at the local shop.
meanings.sent4: She was a crusader for animal rights, always speaking up for the voiceless creatures.
meanings.sent5: The image of the crusaders marching with banners and signs was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: A participant in any of the military expeditions undertaken by Christian powers in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries to recover the Holy Land from the Muslims.
meanings.sent1: The brave crusaders set out on a long journey to reclaim the Holy Land.
meanings.sent2: Many tales are told of the heroic deeds of the crusaders during the medieval times.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends jokingly referred to themselves as the 'snack crusaders' on their road trip.
meanings.sent4: In the video game, the player controls a group of digital crusaders battling evil forces.
meanings.sent5: The image of the crusaders riding into battle on horseback was depicted in the history book.
